communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for all email communications sent or received, including being CCed or BCCed, by Chief of Police Anthony Coleman and anyone with an Atlanta Police Foundation email address (*@atlantapolicefoundation.org) between 1/1/2022 and 3/30/23.

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if the email has an attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Untitled (Kent Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

all correspondence between members of the department via email and cellular text messages that contains references to the use of "aerial drones" or "drones" for the purpose of "surveillance", "crime intervention" or "crime prevention." This correspondence should be limited to correspondence that occurred between January 2016 and March 2022.

In order to help you determine my status for the purpose of assessing fees, you should know that I am a representative of Vice News organization and this request is made as part of news gathering and not for commercial
use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trone Dowd

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: W037642-030922
communications.communication:
Dear Trone Dowd: Thank you
for your interest in public records of the City of Kent. Your request has been
received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on
3/9/2022 and given the reference number W037642-030922
for tracking purposes. Pursuant to RCW 42.56, this response acknowledges receipt of your request for
public records. The City estimates  it will provide a further response
within 5 business days with a determination regarding disclosure, denial, or if
an exemption to disclosure can be established. The City reserves the right to
extend this time frame if necessary. 
Records Requested: COPY OF A POLICE
INCIDENT CASE REPORT Your
request will be forwarded to the relevant city department(s) to locate the
records you seek, and then determine the volume and any costs associated with
satisfying your request.  The City will contact you about the availability
of the records or provide copies of the records responsive to your request. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below.  You will
receive an email notification when your request has been completed. Again,
thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Kent

communications.communication:

City Clerk Kimberley A. Komoto City Clerk 220 4th Avenue South Kent, WA 98032 Fax: 253-856-6725 PHONE:  253-856-5725 
03/15/2022 Trone Dowd MuckRock News DEPT MR 125952 Somerville, MA 02144-2516 Re: Public Records Request, dated 3/9/2022 File #W037642-030922 for Police Incident Case Report Matter – Extension of Time Needed to Respond Dear Trone Dowd: 
On 3/9/2022, you submitted a public records request to the City of Kent wherein you sought records for: all correspondence between members of the department via email and cellular text messages that contains references to the use of "aerial drones" or "drones" for the purpose of "surveillance", "crime intervention" or "crime prevention." This correspondence should be limited to correspondence that occurred between January 2016 and March 2022. The City advised you it anticipated responding to your request within 5 business days. The City now needs  to extend this estimate; and currently estimates it will be able to provide responsive records, either on an installment basis or in total in approximately 25 business days or less. 
This additional time is necessary due to current staffing levels, current volume of public record requests received; locating and assembling the requested records; if necessary notifying any third parties who may be affected by the request; and to determine whether any of the information contained within the requested records is exempt from disclosure, in whole or in part. If you have any questions, please contact the City Clerk’s Office at 253-856-5725. Thank you. Sincerely, Tiffany Alcorn Tiffany Alcorn Lead Public Disclosure Administrator City of Kent Administration 
Derek Matheson, CAO

In accordance with the City's Public Records Request Policy located on the City's website; copied records, or records gathered for inspection, will be available to the requester for 30 calendar days from the date of the City's notification to the requester that the records are available.  If a requester fails to retrieve or inspect the responsive records within that 30-day period, the records request will be deemed abandoned, the records will be returned to the originating department, and the City will close the request. If the records were produced as an installment response under section 1.5.3.4.C, the requester's failure to retrieve or inspect an installment will result in the City discontinuing its search for any remaining records, closing the entire records request. This correspondence should be limited to correspondence that occurred between January 2016 and March 2022. The City of Kent has completed Installment #2 of records relating to the above-referenced public records request, subject to any subsequent clarification that may have been obtained. Additional records responsive to your request have been located, these records  are part of an on-going investigation and are categorically exempt from disclosure at this time in accordance with RCW 42.56.240(1) and Newman v. King County, 133 Wn.2d 565 (1997).  Because records regarding this on-going investigation are categorically exempt from disclosure, no exemption log is required. 
  
  
 
The fee to obtain copies of the responsive records has been waived. 
The records are available at the City’s on-line Public Records Center.  You may access the records by following the below link and instructions: 1. https://www.kentwa.gov/city-hall/city-clerk/public-records-center 2. Click on "My Request Center" 3. Click on "View My Requests" 4. Login to your account, click "Submit" 5. Click on the File # for this request. 6. The electronic records are available in the "Files" window. In accordance with the City's Public Records Request Policy located on the City's website; copied records, or records gathered for inspection, will be available to the requester for 30 calendar days from the date of the City's notification to the requester that the records are available.  If a requester fails to retrieve or inspect the responsive records within that 30-day period, the records request will be deemed abandoned, the records will be returned to the originating department, and the City will close the request. If the records were produced as an installment response under section 1.5.3.4.C, the requester's failure to retrieve or inspect an installment will result in the City discontinuing its search for any remaining records, closing the entire records request. We are continuing to process responsive records for Installment #3 . The City currently estimates it will be able to provide responsive records, either on an installment basis or in total in approximately 60 business days or less. 
If you are not able to access the records at the Public Records Center, or if you have any questions, please contact the City Clerk’s Office at 253-856-5725. 
Thank you. Sincerely, Tiffany Alcorn Tiffany Alcorn Lead Public Disclosure Administrator 
City of Kent Administration 
Arthur “Pat” Fitzpatrick, Interim Chief Administrative Officer

all correspondence between members of the department via email and cellular text messages that contains references to the use of "aerial drones" or "drones" for the purpose of "surveillance", "crime intervention" or "crime prevention." The City has previously provided you with an installment #1 and installment #2 of records responsive to your request.  We are continuing to work on fulfillment of your request but additional time as needed as we are awaiting the return to work of employees who have been on long term leave in order to conduct a reasonable search for any text messages on their department issued cell phones that would be responsive to your request. communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Request - James "Whitey" Bulger
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Absolutely any and all files and materials regarding or referencing James "Whitey" Bulger, whose death in October 2018 was reported by the Washington Post (https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/obituaries/whitey-bulger-boston-crime-boss-and-elusive-fugitive-is-killed-in-prison-at-89/2018/10/30/271ec004-dc61-11e8-b732-3c72cbf131f2_story.html?utm_term=.4ea9ea065faa)

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc.

Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency.

Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carolyn Komatsoulis

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1421025-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Files on Whitey Bulger
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records regarding James "Whitey" Bulger, infamous Boston mobster, including cross-referenced and ELSUR documents. Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://twitter.com/Tom_Winter/status/1057313365431906304

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: ShotSpotter Contract (Cincinnati Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the current contract between this department, the city, and ShotSpotter, Inc. This request includes the full ShotSpotter Services Agreement, Standard Terms and Conditions, terms of service (including square miles covered, total cost, and contract beginning and end dates), any reference service level agreements, contract amendments, cure notices, non-disclosure agreements, or other revisions to agreements.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Katie Ryan

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Bellingham Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Bellingham Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  138583-49247042@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://bellinghamwa.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

communications.subject: Police Department Records Request :: P016356-010923
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: Please note that while staff continue to provide the fullest assistance to all requestors, our response times may be delayed due to staffing shortages across the city as a result of the on-going COVID-19 pandemic. Your patience is very much appreciated. 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Belligham Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 1/9/2023 and given the reference number P016356-010923 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellingham-police-department-7784%252Fpolice-staff-roster-january-2023-bellingham-police-department-138583%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAVjpgQZLkPj-vO60a0SB4kqx8%3A1pF3UR%3AK-yfghygJkhAjnhtBClx3f8AXbg_70AaJxd_u3x98qA 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Bellingham Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Department Records Request :: P016356-010923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose Terse: 
I am writing in response to your recent PRA request for records related to public employees at the City of Bellingham. We have assembled the records that you requested. However, the City is required to provide third-party notice each employee whose information you have requested under RCW 42.56.250(12). We also must provide the employee a reasonable amount of time to seek a court order enjoining the release of the records if they so choose. 
The City has provided the required notice and given the affected employee(s) 10 business days to obtain an order from the Whatcom County Superior Court enjoining the release of the records. If the employee fails to provide a court order during that time, then the non-exempt records will be released to you on February 20, 2023. 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
Regards, 
James Erb 
Sr. Asst. City Attorney 
Public Records Officer 
City of Bellingham

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Department Records Request :: P016356-010923
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 09, 2023, Reference # P016356-010923 

Dear Rose Terse, 

The Bellingham Police Department received a public records request from you on January 09, 2023.You requested the following public records: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellingham-police-department-7784%252Fpolice-staff-roster-january-2023-bellingham-police-department-138583%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAVjpgQZLkPj-vO60a0SB4kqx8%3A1pF3UR%3AK-yfghygJkhAjnhtBClx3f8AXbg_70AaJxd_u3x98qA" 

We had previously notified you that we needed additional time to notify employees covered by this request of the placement of the request and the material to be released. Unfortunately, due to staffing issues, we need additional time to complete the process of notification. At this time we anticipate having responses completed in time to release the requested materials, should no injunction be filed, on or before the February 27, 2023. 

If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office. 

Sincerely, 

Alexandra Copeland 
Police Records Manager 
Police

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Job Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

THIS IS A CONTINUATION OF MY PREVIOUS REQUEST WITH REFERENCE NUMBER: DR22_027830. NOTE THAT THIS REQUEST WAS CLOSED DUE TO MY FAILURE TO SPECIFY IF I WANTED TO CONTINUE RECEIVING DATA. IT IS UNCLEAR WHICH YEARS WERE GIVEN TO ME IN THE PREVIOUS REQUEST.

All completed job applications from prospective (hired or not hired) applicants to the police department dating from January 1, 2014 to July 1, 2021. In particular I am looking for (but not restricted to) the following information from each applicant: date application received and/or processed, application unique identifier (if exists), gender/sex (if exists), race (if exists), and any resume/CV/cover letters attached. However, any and all information of the applicantion that is available is most preferred.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael Topper

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Positive COVID-19 cases from 3/1/23 through 3/31/23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents showing the cumulative number of positive COVID-19 cases among students and staff at each RUSD school site, facility and department, from March 1, 2023 through March 31, 2023.

Such documents may include but may not be limited to: spreadsheets, databases, charts, tables, infographics, slide decks, reports, emails and other records, electronic or otherwise.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Beck

This message is to confirm your request submission to the FOIAonline application: View Request. Request information is as follows: (https://www.foiaonline.gov/foiaonline/action/public/submissionDetails?trackingNumber=DON-USMC-2022-001371&type=request) 
 
  * Tracking Number: DON-USMC-2022-001371 
  * Requester Name: Paul Szoldra 
  * Date Submitted: 11/07/2021 
  * Request Status: Submitted 
  * Description:
					To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Documents produced under Marine Corps Inspector General Case IDs: 21389, 20806, 20591. These cases were closed on Aug. 21, 2020. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Paul Szoldra, Task & Purpose 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmarines-27%252Figmc-substantiated-misconduct-aug-21-2020-121066%252F%253Femail%253Dhqmcfoia%252540usmc.mil&url_auth_token=AABaruStq3VSmV0nX0JIKtp8GOM%3A1mjiVM%3Azt6ALAX8YdeYVmSM2KE5PI0jZE0

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Yale Justice Collaboratory (Minneapolis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails with representatives of the Yale Justice Collaboratory from 2020 to present. Specifically, I request emails sent to or received from an email address with the domain "@yale.edu" that were sent between 01/01/2020 and 03/05/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Micah Moody

 If you need to reset your password, please go to OpenCity and click the “Forgot Password” link in the top right corner to be emailed a new password. Learn About Data Practices Our OpenCity portal includes an Knowledge Base with articles about how to submit an effective data request, answers to frequently asked questions, and information about data practices at the City. (https://minneapolis.service-now.com/opencityportal?id=kb_view2) 
 Available Data To explore data already published online from the City of Minneapolis, please visit the Minneapolis Open Government web page. (http://www.minneapolismn.gov/government/open/index.htm) 
 Creating a New Request Now that you have registered, you can log into the OpenCity portal to: 
 submit a request for data. check the status of your requests. communicate with the Data Practices team about a specific request. receive responsive data directly through the portal. 
 Please do not reply to this email. 
 Thank you,

communications.subject: OpenCity data request DR23_042794 - Your request has been resolved
communications.communication:
Hi 142119-70129669@requests.muckrock.com 
Contact us 
 This resolved request will remain under My Open Requests on the OpenCity Portal for two weeks. During that time, you may contact us regarding your request through the portal, or by replying to this email. 
 Closed requests After two weeks, your request will move to My Closed Requests on the OpenCity Portal. You will be able to see your request for 60 days; however, you will no longer be able to contact us regarding this request in the portal. Once your request is closed you will need to contact us at ResponsibleAuthority@minneapolismn.gov. You must include your reference number, and if possible, forward this email with your communication. We will respond to you as soon as we can. (mailto:ResponsibleAuthority@minneapolismn.gov)

title: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Watervliet City School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Watervliet City School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking all records related to the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and the Council on School Health (COSH), including any communications or correspondence between the school district and these organizations, or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

To help identify responsive records, you can limit your time period to 1/1/2017 until the date of final response; also I request that you search for the following terms, which are focused on the American Academy of Pediatrics and its affiliated organizations:

"American Academy of Pediatrics"
"AAP"
"Council on School Health"
"COSH"
"pediatric"
"child health"
"school health"

Please include records of any type, including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, presentations, and any other records of communication or correspondence between the American Academy of Pediatrics, the Council on School Health, and the school district or any other party that may have provided information to the district from these organizations.

If no records are responsive to this request, please provide a certification of that fact pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3), and inform me of the district's obligations under LGS-01 to retain records until any appeal has been resolved.

If any records are withheld, please provide an explanation of the legal basis for the withholding.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Re: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Communications with American Academy of Pediatrics and Council on School Health (Watervliet City School District)
communications.communication:
This is to certify that I am in receipt of your e-mail regarding
a Freedom of Information Law request (see below).



We are in the process of reviewing this request.  Within 20 business days,
we will provide any records we have in response to this request. Please
note the following charges may apply:



1.  Pages not larger than 9 inches by 14 inches: 25 cents per page.

2.  Pages larger than 9 inches by 14 inches: 35 cents per page.

3.  Other permissible fees for requests that require a large volume of
material and/or time to fully comply.

Sincerely,


*Bernadette L. Boardman*
Executive Assistant to the Superintendent
Clerk of the Board
FOIL Officer
Watervliet City School District
1245 Hillside Drive
Watervliet, NY  12189
Phone: (518) 629-3201
Fax: (518) 629-3265

*"Be the change you wish to see in the world"*


-- 
This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential and intended 
solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. 
This message contains confidential information and is intended only for the 
individual named. If you are not the named addressee you should not 
disseminate, distribute or copy this e-mail. Please notify the sender 
immediately by e-mail if you have received this e-mail by mistake and 
delete this e-mail from your system. If you are not the intended recipient 
you are notified that disclosing, copying, distributing or taking any 
action in reliance on the contents of this information is strictly 
prohibited.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Amtrak Board of Directors - Meeting Agendas and Minutes | Jan 2023 & Feb 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The agenda and minutes for any meeting of the Amtrak Board of Directors that occurred in the months of January 2023 or February 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Heckscher

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mel Weinberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Melvin Weinberg (December 4, 1924 – May 30, 2018), who was an American con artist, charlatan and federal government informant who is known for his involvement in the Abscam sting operation in the late 1970s and early 1980s. At the time of the scandal, he was a convict hired by the Federal Bureau of Investigation to conduct the operation in exchange for probation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mel Weinberg
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022. 
Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rex Anthony Sites

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on December 8, 2022.  Specifically, you requested:

"Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

"Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."

The district is processing your request.  The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than February 1, 2023.  This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request.  As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney
Director of Human Resources
Mukilteo School District
9401 Sharon Drive
Everett, Washington 98204
425-356-1298
barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu>
Pronouns: he/him/his

Employment Opportunities - https://www.mukilteoschools.org/Page/937

[Image]

The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material, the disclosure of which is governed by applicable law. Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon, this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is prohibited. If you received this in error, please contact the sender and destroy the materials contained in this message.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In my December 15, 2022, email to you in response to your December 8, 2022 request for records, I estimated the first installment of those records would be available to you by February 1, 2023.

In our subsequent search for records, we have found over 23,300 email records that may be responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

With the way your request is worded and in order to provide you with all the emails you are requesting, we will need to review each one of the 23,300 records to determine if they are responsive and possibly make redactions to the records.  This will take a significant amount of time.  Therefore, we invite you to narrow your request.  Are there any more specific terms you would like to provide regarding specific complaints or individuals for whom you are looking for records?

If you would like to proceed with your request as written, please let me know and I will update the expected timeline for processing the request.  I look forward to receiving a reply from you about how you would like to proceed with your request.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Per RCW 42.56. 250(12), I am providing you with a copy of the third party notification to Ms. Carnahan (formerly Donovan), as attached hereto.

Please note, the record has been redacted per RCW 42.56.230(3).  Ms. Carnahan's personal email address has been redacted because disclosing it would violate her right to privacy.  Please also note that, due to a delay in providing the notification and the need to provide her with 10 days' notice before releasing the records, our initial installment of responsive records will be delayed approximately one week, to February 9,, 2023.

Finally, please see my previous email below regarding a possible narrowing of the other item from your December 8, 2022 request, to which you have not yet responded.  Have a good day.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Attached is the first installment of records responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."  A redaction log is also included.

The district will continue its search for records for this request and also for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

As another reminder, on January 25 I invited you to narrow your search to help expedite the search for records responsive to the Cisco Gomez item above.  After further searching, we have reduced the number of potentially responsive email records to 12,810, which will take a significant amount of time to review.  Absent an updated request to revise our search, we will continue to search based on your original request.

At this time. we anticipate a second installment of records will be sent to you no later than April 1, 2023.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: North Dakota State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the North Dakota Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to the present. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within the offices of the Governor and Lieutenant Governor and all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to May 31, 2022.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, title, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service status, and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

If these data are not available at monthly intervals, please produce the datasets at the most frequent interval possible. For example, if the data is not available monthly, please produce the data at quarterly intervals.

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if departments are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so.

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: RE: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: North Dakota State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Hi Lynn, 

Thanks so much for your assistance. I really appreciate it!

Take care, 
Ben

communications.subject: RE: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: North Dakota State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Dear Lynn, 

I hope it was a good weekend. I am following up on this request from a few months ago with a quick question. Is it possible to receive a copy of these data that includes employees' dates of birth -- or is that not publicly available? 

Thanks!
Ben

communications.subject: RE: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: North Dakota State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Hi Lynn, 

I apologize for the double email -- but I have one other question in addition to the one about employees' dates of birth. 

The data you sent me includes two date variables: eff_date and start_date. Could you please provide me with some additional information about the definitions of these variables? In particular, does start_date mean the date that someone first started working for the state, so it should theoretically never change even if the employee leaves and then comes back? 

Thank you for all of your time and assistance -- I really appreciate it. 

Best,
Ben

communications.subject: RE: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: North Dakota State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Ben,
Start date is the initial hire date for an individual.  As you stated, theoretically this should not change even if the employee leaves and comes back.

Effective date is the date of the most recent record change for the employee.  It could be a hire, a transfer, a job change or some sort of administrative change, but most commonly it would be the last time that the employee received a salary change.

Lynn Hart, SPHR, SHRM-SCP, CCP, CEBS
Total Rewards Manager

files.title: image001
files.source: Department of Human Services, North Dakota

communications.subject: RE: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: North Dakota State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Ben,
Under ND Century Code 44-04-18.1(2) a state employee’s month and day of birth are considered personal information that is exempt from the open records requirements.


Lynn Hart, SPHR, SHRM-SCP, CCP, CEBS
Total Rewards Manager

title: Records RE: Homekey Purchase and Conveyance of 1591 Casa Buena Drive

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Records RE: Homekey Purchase and Conveyance of 1591 Casa Buena Drive
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A Copy  standard agreement Number 20-HK-00057

A copy of the agreement between the County of Marin and California Department of Housing and Community Development to Purchase 1591 Casa Buena Drive

A copy of the Deed for 1591 Casa Buena Drive

The preliminary title report on the property issued to the County of Marin on April 4th, 2021. 

A copy of the 55 year affordability covenant subject upon 1591 Casa Buena Drive

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Village of Niles Confederate Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

emails to/from village of Niles email addresses between February 1, 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates) that include any of the keywords:

– "confederate"
– "murder mystery"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Village of Niles public records request #23-203
communications.communication:
Village of Niles ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-203: ear Niles Coalition:   Thank you for writing to Village of Niles with your request for information pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.   On March 19, you requested the following documents:   emails to/from village of Niles email addresses between February 1, 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates) that include any of the keywords:   – "confederate"   – "murder mystery"   The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.   Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for the following reason(s):   We cannot comply with the request for records within the 5 business day time limit without unduly burdening or interfering with our operations.   The public body asserts the following facts in support of the above reasons for an extension of time. The Village will respond to your request by April 3, 2023. Please acknowledge receipt of this request for extension.   Thank you,   Margaret Keating FOIA Officer | Village of Niles (847) 588-8014 | mrk@vniles.com      ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Village of Niles.

title: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (California State University Northridge)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (California State University Northridge)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { California Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: Records Request: Tier II and III Disciplinary Tickets

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Records Request: Tier II and III Disciplinary Tickets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Documents regarding the number of Tier II and III disciplinary tickets given out between 2020 and 2022
2. DOCCS memos regarding the expansion of what can be taken away from people charged with Tier II tickets (from 2022, in the past month)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Brown

title: FBI UAV Certificates of Waiver or Authorization (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI UAV Certificates of Waiver or Authorization (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of Certificate of Waiver or Authorization (COAs) granted to the FBI from 1995 to the present, along with applications/requests submitted by the FBI regardless of whether they were granted or not.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the Internet Archive and MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category.

As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have

    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the
    relevance of this particular subject in advance.
    
    Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not
    required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126
    (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15
    (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as
    well, I qualify as a member of the news media.
    
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the
    request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. §
    552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative
    of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for
    which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Copies of Certificate of Waiver or Authorization (COAs) granted to the FBI
    from 1995 to the present, along with applications/requests submitted by the
    FBI regardless of whether they were granted or not.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI UAV Certificates of Waiver or Authorization (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mercy Loyo

communications.subject: Alaska DOC public records request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

On December 29, 2022, the Alaska Department of Corrections (DOC) received your public records request (PRR).

You requested the following:
a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).
b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.


As allowed by 2AAC 96.325, I anticipate being able to provide the information you request in ten working days of receipt of your request, on January 13, 2023.


It is important to note there may be a cost associated with public records searches, an estimate of which is based on the parameters of your search. Once you acknowledge you would like to proceed with this request, I can provide you with an estimated cost of the search. Please note that the estimate is for costs associated with searching DOC records and is no guarantee that any responsive records exist. We may not locate any records responsive to your request, and you will still be charged the search fee. If responsive records are located, then those documents allowable for release will be made available to you.

Respectfully,
Betsy

[cid:image001.png@01D91C29.FFFDA4B0]
